scenario:
A comprehensive study found that over 50 years, dividend-paying stocks delivered an annual return of 9.17%, compared to 4.27% for non-dividend payers. Dividend stocks also experienced less volatility. Three top-notch dividend-paying stocks to consider are Chubb, S&P Global, and Aflac.

Chubb, a multinational insurance company, has displayed excellent underwriting and strong cash flows, resulting in 31 consecutive years of dividend increases. Its dividend yield is around 1.4%, but combining it with stock price appreciation has resulted in over 13% annual returns.

S&P Global, a leading credit ratings company, dominates the industry with a 50% market share. It has faced headwinds in recent years but has a strong data and analytics business providing steady cash flows. S&P Global has raised its dividend for 53 consecutive years, providing a reliable income stream and stellar returns of 14% annually.

Aflac, a life and supplemental health insurance company, has benefited from lower claims costs and higher interest rates. It has increased its dividend for 42 consecutive years, offering an attractive annual yield of 2% and returns of 17% annually since it began raising its payout.
